rules_or_instructions: 1. Follow the line clearance system before starting the operations as per respective SOP PAP-QA-002.
2. Follow the current good manufacturing practices.
3. Follow the approved Standard Operating Procedures.
4. Ensure that Personnel are trained for the allocated job.
5. When you document, ensure that the entry is correct and legible. If any discrepancy or mistake is observed during documentation, correct as per SOP No. IR-QA-002.
6. Ensure that plant utility, RLAF, LAF and AHU units are in running condition.
7. Read the manufacturing instructions before proceeding with operations and follow it and document each operation in BMR.
8. Ensure that all required RM and PPM are approved.
9. Follow entry-exit procedure into respective area as per SOP No. PAP-SM-001 and PAP-SM-002.
10. Ensure the environmental condition %RH, Temperature and Differential pressure are within limit.
11. In case additional pages are required, get the same issued from QA and attach.
12. Attach all dispensing labels / in process weight printouts on Exhibit-VIII (Page for Pasting Labels/ Printouts) as per SOP No. PAP-SM-054 and attach with BMR.
13. Before signature at specified place, follow the responsibility as per below.
14. Review the Audit trail of equipment's as per SOP No. IR-MF-001
15. Doer: A person who perform the activity or gets things done with efficiency according to procedure.
16. Done by: Signature of person actually doing the operation, test, inspection, calculation etc. being recorded.
17. Checked by: The person responsible for observing the actual procedure or witnessing performance of the task or performing an independent check to ensure the task was done correctly.
18. Verified by: A person who ensure or demonstrates that activity performed by doer is true, accurate or justified.
19. Reviewed by: Signature of the person responsible for reviewing and examining the documentation certifying that the record/protocol/report has been reviewed and found completed and in compliance.
20. Ensured by: The person responsible for ensuring the procedure or witnessing performance of the task or performing an independent check to ensure the task was done correctly.
21. Ensure that preventive maintenance, Qualification of equipment's and calibration of instruments are within due date.

rules_or_instructions: 1.0 GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS
22. Store the bulk solution under nitrogen blanketing (if applicable).
Product Specific Instruction:
23. Nitrogen gas to be used as inert gas for filtration purpose.
24. Store the bulk solution in a closed SS vessel between 15°C to 25°C.
25. The maximum pressure for 1st and final filtration should not more than 2.5 bar.
26. Bubble point determination should be carried out at 20-25°C.
27. Terminal sterilization parameters: NLT 121°C for NLT 15 minutes.
28. Dispense required quantity of Hydrochloric Acid IP in glass container with suitable capacity.

rules_or_instructions: 5.0 PROCESS FLOW DIAGRAM

The Process Flow Diagram illustrates the manufacturing steps for Multiple Electrolytes Injection Type 1 USP. The process begins with Materials Issuance, followed by Raw Materials dispensing, and then Manufacturing. During manufacturing, there is an In Process Testing of Unfiltered Bulk. The bulk solution is then filtered through a primary filter and transferred to a filtration vessel. This is followed by In Process Testing of Filtered Bulk and filtration through a final filter. Simultaneously, materials for bag making (Twist Off Port, Polypropylene Tube Roll, Polypropylene Film Roll, and Hot Stamping Foil) are issued and processed through PPM Dispensing, Thermal Transfer Print Ribbon, and Bag Making, Printing, Filling, and Stoppering. The filled bags undergo In Process Testing of Filled Bags. The final steps are Terminal Sterilization and Finished Product Sampling.
BATCH PREPARATION AREA
FILTRATION AND FILLING AREA

DISPENSING] RD --> M[MANUFACTURING] M --> IPTUB[I PROCESS TESTING OF UNFILTERED BULK] IPTUB --> M M --> FBP[FILTRATION OF BULK SOLUTION THROUGH PRIMARY FILTER] FBP --> FV[FILTRATION VESSEL] FV --> IPTFB[I PROCESS TESTING OF FILTERED BULK] IPTFB --> FV FV --> FBF[FILTRATION OF BULK SOLUTION THROUGH FINAL FILTER] FBF --> BAG[BAG MAKING, PRINTING, FILLING, STOPPERING] BAG --> IPTFBAG[I PROCESS TESTING OF FILLED BAGS] IPTFBAG --> BAG BAG --> TS[TERMINAL STERILIZATION] TS --> FPS[FINISHED PRODUCT SAMPLING] MI --> TOP[TWIST OFF PORT] MI --> PPT[POLYPROPYLENE TUBE ROLL] MI --> PPF[POLYPROPYLENE FILM ROLL] MI --> HS[Hot Stamping Foil] TOP --> PPM[PPM. DISPENSING] PPM --> BAG PPT --> BAG PPF --> BAG HS --> TTPR[Thermal Transfer Print Ribbon] TTPR --> BAG

The Process Flow Diagram illustrates the manufacturing steps for Multiple Electrolytes Injection Type 1 USP. The process begins with Materials Issuance, followed by Raw Materials dispensing, and then Manufacturing. During manufacturing, there is an In Process Testing of Unfiltered Bulk. The bulk solution is then filtered through a primary filter and transferred to a filtration vessel. This is followed by In Process Testing of Filtered Bulk and filtration through a final filter. Simultaneously, materials for bag making (Twist Off Port, Polypropylene Tube Roll, Polypropylene Film Roll, and Hot Stamping Foil) are issued and processed through PPM Dispensing, Thermal Transfer Print Ribbon, and Bag Making, Printing, Filling, and Stoppering. The filled bags undergo In Process Testing of Filled Bags. The final steps are Terminal Sterilization and Finished Product Sampling.

rules_or_instructions: MANUFACTURING PROCESS

Note: - Make up to 100% of batch size: Make up the volume in SS 316L 4000L manufacturing vessel (EQP/P1/PRD/039) to 100% batch size by using the WFI (which is kept separately in suitable vessel as per calculation given below). Weight per mL of final bulk solution: 0.99 g/mL at 25°C±5°C.
Calculation:
Volume Make up in Kg = Std. Wt. /mL of bulk × B. Size (L) = 0.99g/mL × 4000 L = 3960.0 Kg
Note: After final volume make up blanket the bulk solution in vessel with 0.2μ filtered nitrogen and maintain the temperature of bulk solution at 15.0°C to 25.0°C.

• Take a syringe with appropriate capacity as per requirement based on filled volume.
• Ensure the plunger is properly fixed inside the syringe barrel.
• Ensure the plunger tip is pushed up to the barrel tip so that there is no air present inside the syringe
• Fix the needle with syringe.
• Hold a container vertically in hand and make sure that bottom surface as well as body of the container shall not touch to any surface.
• Insert the needle inside the sealed unit through injection port care and tube portion.
• Ensure the needle should not touch into liquid present inside sealed unit and inner surface of container
• Now gently draw headspace air present inside the sealed unit by pulling the plunger until liquid shall entering inside the syringe.
• The points at which liquid starts entering inside the syringe is end point of headspace in air measurement.
• Now observed the reading in syringe and record the approx. air volume (in mL) in Below table
